original_solution_mapping.L1: John has made $250 in 10 days, so this means he makes $250/10=<<250/10=25>>25 dollars a day.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Since John wants to make double his current amount, this means he wants to make 250*2=<<250*2=500>>500 dollars
original_solution_mapping.L3: This means John needs to work 500/25= <<500/25=20>>20 days in total to make 500.
original_solution_mapping.L4: As John has already worked 10 days, this means he needs to work 20-10=<<20-10=10>>10 more days to make his goal.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6694.
    Returns: the number of additional days John must work.
    """
    # L1
    total_made = 250 # So far, he's made $250
    days_worked_initial = 10 # 10 days ago
    daily_earnings = total_made / days_worked_initial

    # L2
    double_multiplier = 2 # twice this amount
    target_amount = total_made * double_multiplier

    # L3
    total_days_needed = target_amount / daily_earnings

    # L4
    additional_days_needed = total_days_needed - days_worked_initial

    # FA
    answer = additional_days_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: John has made ${total_made} in {days_worked_initial} days, so this means he makes ${total_made}/{days_worked_initial}=<<{total_made}/{days_worked_initial}={daily_earnings}>>{daily_earnings} dollars a day.
Since John wants to make double his current amount, this means he wants to make {total_made}*{double_multiplier}=<<{total_made}*{double_multiplier}={target_amount}>>{target_amount} dollars
This means John needs to work {target_amount}/{daily_earnings}= <<{target_amount}/{daily_earnings}={total_days_needed}>>{total_days_needed} days in total to make {target_amount}.

As John has already worked {days_worked_initial} days, this means he needs to work {total_days_needed}-{days_worked_initial}=<<{total_days_needed}-{days_worked_initial}={additional_days_needed}>>{additional_days_needed} more days to make his goal.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: John has made $250 in 10 days, so this means he makes $250/10=<<250/10=25>>25 dollars a day.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Since John wants to make double his current amount, this means he wants to make 250*2=<<250*2=500>>500 dollars
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: This means John needs to work 500/25= <<500/25=20>>20 days in total to make 500.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: As John has already worked 10 days, this means he needs to work 250-10=<<250-10=240>>240 more days to make his goal.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'total_made' (value: 250) was used instead of 'total_days_needed' (value: 20.0).
